ygData.subject: Re: ARCReader API
ygData.msgSnippet: You may as well check your path. I also use 1.2.0, I can use arcreader to read arc file. The command I used is like: /yourpath/heritrix-1.2.0/bin/arcreader

You may as well check your path. 

I also use 1.2.0, I can use arcreader to read arc file. The command I 
used is like:

/yourpath/heritrix-1.2.0/bin/arcreader /yourpath/heritrix-1.2.0/jobs/
yourjobname/arcs/******.arc.gz > *****.cdx

or 

/yourpath/heritrix-1.2.0/bin/arcreader /yourpath/heritrix-1.2.0/jobs/
yourjobname/arcs/******.arc > ****.cdx

Arc file format: 
http://www.archive.org/web/researcher/ArcFileFormat.php
http://pages.alexa.com/company/arcformat.html

cdx file format:
http://www.archive.org/web/researcher/example_cdx.php

Then you may use the offset info in cdx file to access each uri file 
the arc saved.

The command is like: 
/yourpath/heritrix-1.2.0/bin/arcreader --offset=438731 /yourpath/
heritrix-1.2.0/jobs/yourjobname/arcs/******.arc.gz

Good luck!
Yan
--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Rev Tamas" <bridgeman@i...> 
wrote:
> Hello!
>   Now I'm trying to read the crawled html files using the API 
provided
> by heritrix. While reading gzipped ARC files, I alwas get an error 
message
> "Failed to find GZIP MAGIC". Do you have any ideas, how to fix this 
bug?
> The heritrix I use has is built on source version 1.2.0.
>   If I try to read unzipped ARCs using the next() method of 
ARCReader,
> I always get the whole file as one record: The first record's 
metadata is
> the datablock starts like this "filedesc://" and I cannot get 
records any
> more. How can I use this API properly?
> Tamas
